column5: Hydrant (Hydrogen H). Blue for "first place" (blue ribbon) and for water, its principal compound - tall and thin, shaped like a "1". Hydrant sounds like hydrogen (both refer to water).
Helium Balloon (Helium He). Silver colored for"second place" (silver medal) - a noble color for a noble gas.
Lithium watch battery (Lithium Li), 3-volt. Lilac colored(sounds like lithium and all three natural minerals are lilaccolored).
Beryl-studded Belt Buckle (Beryllium Be). Rectangular (4 sides),with four pink beryls (beryl is a pink gem: beryllium aluminum silicate).
Box of Borax (Boron B). 5-pound box, dark brown, the color of pure boron(borax is hydrated sodium borate).
Charcoal pencil (Carbon C). Black, the color of charcoal and also of graphite (carbon) in pencil leads. Hexagonal (6-sided).
Dynamite, or Nitroglycerin (Nitrogen N). Two red sticks, shaped like a "7" (most explosives contain nitrogen).
Oxygen-filled Lifepreservers (Oxygen O). White for air,which preserves life. Two of them touching, shaped like an "8".
Fluoride Toothpaste (Fluorine F). Purple, the color of the mineral fluorite (calcium fluoride), and shaped like a 9.
Neon Sign (Neon Ne). Shaped like a "10," flashing orange,like the orange/red color of neon in neon signs.
Narrow Soda Crackers (Sodium Na). Two of them, brightyellow, shaped like an "11," like the bright yellow sodium D spectrallines. Sodium is named for soda (sodium carbonate).
Mug. (Magnesium Mg) 12 oz. green mug made of olivine(magnesium silicate), filledwith milk of magnesia (magnesium hydroxide). Magnesium in chlorophyll gives plants their green color.
Aluminum Ladder (Aluminum Al). Unlucky to walk under, and 13 isunlucky. Turquoise (blue-green) colored (turquoise is hydrated aluminum phosphate.
Silicon Chip (Silicon Si). It as 14 pins, and is the tan color of sand (silicon dioxide) or sandstone (silica).

Phosphorus Matches (Phosphorus P). Red/white striped book of 15,heads white, striker red (there are both white and red forms of phosphorus).The matches could light the dynamite (nitrogen) in the periodic table.
Sulfuric Acid (Sulfur S). One pint (16 oz.), pale yellow in a flask.

Clorox (Chlorine Cl). Yellow-green bottle, the color of chlorine gas ("chloros" means yellow-green in Greek). Cleans 17 ways (Clorox is sodium hypochlorite). Note that Clorox has no letter "h" making it easy to remember the abbreviation Cl.
Argon-filled Fluorescent Light (Argon Ar). 18-inch, sky-blue (air is 1% argon).

Kettle, or Pot of gray Ashes (Potassium K).19th-century way to make soap from potash (potassium is named for potash, potassium carbonate or hydroxide,which is named for the pot of ashes used to obtain it).
Calcite Pearls (Calcium Ca). Ivory A string of 20 pearls. Calcite is a formof calcium carbonate.
Scandal Page (Scandium Sc). One should be 21 years old to read the scandal page of the newspaper.
Titanic (Titanium Ti). The Titanic had 2200 passengers when it hit an iceberg and sank.
Chev Van (Vanadium V). 23-passenger van made withvanadium steel.
Chrome-plated Creamer (Chromium Cr). 24-oz. pitcher ofcream
Autumn Mangos (Manganese Mn). 25 of them,
Ferris Wheel (Iron Fe). 26-seats and made of iron. Sounds like "ferrous," which refers to iron.
Cobblestone (Cobalt Co). It is a 3" cube, so it has a volume of 27 cubic inches.
Nickel (Nickel Ni). In 1928, the year before the GreatDepression, people had more money (a nickel) than in the next year ('29). The U.S. coin called a "nickel" used to be made of nickel.
Copper Penny (Copper Cu). The Currency during the Great Depression which began in'29.
Brazen and zinc sink (Zinc Zn). Made of galvanized iron (iron coated with zinc),with $30 brass (brazen means brass) faucet. Brass is an alloy of copper and zinc. Sink sounds like zinc.
Galleon (Gallium Ga). The old Spanish galleons had three masts, each of which looked likea "1," to remind us of 31.
German beer. (Germanium Ge) A quart stein (32 fl. oz.) of German beer. Germanium was namedfor Germany.

A skull & crossbones (Arsenic As). Rat poison is arsenic trioxide, commonly called simply"arsenic." In other forms, such as is found in apples, arsenic is nutritious. Arsenic has three naturalvarieties: black, gray and yellow, as shown by the three colors in the icon.
Sensitive solar cell leaning (Selenium Se). Leaning at a 34° angle off vertical. Sounds like selenium. Solar cells often contain selenium.
Broom (Bromine Br). 35 Bristles (seven rows of five). In the periodic table,note that all the elements in this column are cleaners.
Krypton Yardstick. (Krypton Kr). One yard is 36 inches. Krytongas is used to define the scientific unit of length, the meter, whichis about a yard long.
Superb ruby (Rubidium Rb). red ruby, 37-carat.
Israeli Strongbox (Strontium Sr). Bright red because the red in mostfireworks is from strontium. It weighs 38 pounds.
A Tree (Yttrium Y). Y-shaped, with a "39" carved in it. Sounds like yttrium.
Ezra's Zircon Ring (Zirconium Zr). Only cost $40.
Unbearable Onion (Niobium Nb). "For one" person only.Sounds like Niobium and like "4,1". In Greek mythology, Niobe weptfor the loss of her children, like an onion makes you weep.
Molly's Denims (Molybdenum Mo). 42" waist. Sounds like Molybdenum.
Dutch Technician (Technetium Tc). 43-years-old. Technetiumwas made synthetically - it is not stable enough to be found in nature.
Ruth's hen (Ruthenium Ru). It's feet look like 44 and "Ruth's hen"sounds like Ruthenium.It is also by the wren and ostrich in the periodic table.
Road in Rhode Island. (Rhodium Rh). Speed Limit 45 m.p.h.
Top dog Palace (Palladium Pd). The sultan has 46 wives in its 46 towers, which look like 46.
Agnes's Silver Dime (Silver Ag). '47 was A Good year after WW II. (Silver is "argentum" in Latin).
CD Caddy (Cadmium Cd) The caddy holds 4 dozen (48) CD's.
India Ink (Indium In). 49 cent bottle.
Tin Can (Tin Sn). Contains 50 Snails. Tin cans are made of steelsometimes covered with a thin layer of tin.
Ant money. (Antimony Sb). Taking small bills ($5 and $1) to its passbook account.
Deck of 52 Cards (Tellurium Te). "Tell your" fortune. (Sounds like Tellurium)
Iodine (Iodine I). Bottle costs 53 cents.
Zenith television, watching "Xena" (Xenon Xe). On channel 54 - a TV tube contains xenon gas.
Cesium Standard Clock (Cesium Cs). A physics clock. It reads 5:05 - time to go home.
Bad Berries (Barium Ba). Poisonous. About 5/6 of allwhite berries are poisonous (really). Black are usually edible.
Lantern (Lanthanum La). 57 candle-power.
Cereal bowl (Cerium Ce). Has 58 nutrients.
Praying mantis (Praseodymium Pr). Eats 59 bugs.
No Dim Lights (Neodymium Nd). Triangular sign has 60° angles. Bright lights can blind.
Prominent fire (Promethium Pm). Fire is needed after 6:10 p.m. Promethius brought fire to mankind. The flames look like 61.
Small samurai sword (Samarium Sm). 62 generations of use.
European rope (63 feet long). (Europium Eu).
Magdalene's Cattle (Gadolinium Gd). "Cattle" sounds like "gadol"inium.Checkerboard pattern (a checkerboard has 8x8 = 64 squares).
Bright blue turban (Terbium Tb). 65" long.
Dandy disposal (Dysprosium Dy). Disposes garbage in 6.6 seconds.
Home (Holmium Ho). This home has room for 6 or 7 children.
Herb (Erbium Er). The stems and leaves form a hidden 68 in the picture.
Christmas Tulip (Thulium Tm). Red and green for Christmas. 69 kinds.
Ladybug Litterbag. (Ytterbium Yb). A litterbag (small portable trash bag),which sounds like Ytterium, with a ladybug picture on it with 70 spots.Litterbags were popular in the '70s.
Lute (Lutetium Lu). 7 Strings on 1 Lute (71).
Faithful Half Dollar. (Hafnium Hf). 72 is half a gross (of 144).Also, there are 72 ounces of silver in $100 of silver halves (or quarters or dimes).The ones dated 1964 or earlier are silver.
Tan Tall Man (Tantalum Ta). He is 7' 3" tall basketball player.
Westinghouse light bulb (Tungsten W). 74 Watt, with tungsten filament. Another name for tungsten is Wolfram, which explains the abbreviation.
Wren (Rhenium Re). Visualize 75 of them on a telephone line.
Ostrich (Osmium Os). 7'6" Tall. Also, its neck & head look like a 7 and its body like a 6.
Iridescent Rainbow (Iridium Ir). 7 Colors in a rainbow (77).Iris was the Greek goddess of the rainbow.
Platinum Record (Platinum Pt). The old kind that rotatedat a speed of 78 rpm. Recorded by "The Egyptians." A platinum recording soldmore copies than a gold, and platinum is worth more than gold.
Gold Coin (Gold Au). A '79 A.U. (AlmostUncirculated.) The latin word for gold is aurum.
High-grade Thermometer (Mercury Hg). Showing 80 degrees.
Tallow Candle (Thallium Tl). 81. Looks like a "1" and sounds like"tallow." Used in castles.
Lead Plumbing (Lead Pb). Under the cupboard. 82% lead. The latin word for lead is plumbum.
Pepto Bismol (Bismuth Bi). I "ate 3" teaspoons of Pepto Bismol (sounds like "83").Pepto Bismol contains Bismuth Subsalicylate.
Polo Stick (Polonium Po). 7 dozen (84) polo sticks.
A tall Aster [85 petals] (Astatine At). The flowers, stem and leaf form an "85".
Radar warning. (Radon Rn). Protection for 86 miles.
France's Eiffel Tower (Francium Fr). Built for the World's Fair and commemorated thecentenniel of the French Revolution which technically began in 1787.
Radio (Radium Ra). Piano music (88 keys) on FM 88.
Actor (Actinium Ac). He won 89 oscars.
Thorn (Thorium Th). Thorns stick out at 90° angle.
Paper protractor (Protactinium Pa). Measuring 91°, one degree more than a right angle. Use it to measure the angle of the thorns next to it.
Uranium A-Bomb. (Uranium U). 92 Kilotons. Memorize Uranus,Neptune and Pluto (the planets in a row) for 92, 93, 94.
Neptunian pitchfork (Neptunium Np). Neptune's trident is 9' long with 3 prongs. Memorize Uranus,Neptune and Pluto (the planets in a row) for 92, 93, 94.
Pluto the Pup (Plutonium Pu). Mickey Mouse's dog. Memorize Uranus,Neptune and Pluto (the planets in a row) for 92, 93, 94, and remember thatPluto's ears look like a 94.
American flag (Americium Am). Cost $95 .
Acme's curious curtains (Curium Cm). For a standard 8-foot tall room (96").
Rib knit Beret (Berkelium Bk). '97 style. Named for Berkeley, California, whereberets have been seen.
Cauli-flower (Californium Cf). Remember Berkeley, California, are consecutiveand that there is a 98 hidden in the cauliflower. California produces a lot of cauliflower.
Einstein's esoteric earrings. (Einsteinium Es). The hidden meaning is thathis theory predicts you can only go 99% of the speed of light.
Fur mink (Fermium Fm). "Fur" sounds like fermium.It cost 100 thousand dollars and is 100% real fur from mink.
Mental M.D. (Mendelevium Md). They work on brains. Mental MD's alltook Psychology 101.
No Bell (Nobelium No). The red bar divides the picture into two parts, toremember 102.
Laurel Wreath. (Lawrencium Lr). It has 103 leaves, and this one wasalso made with bulrushes.
Ruth's perfect Ford. (Rutherfordium Rf). It has 4 wheels and Ford sounds like"four" to remember 104. The Model-T was so "perfect" that is was popular for many years.
Hand. (Hahnium Ha). Has 5 fingers, for 5 more than 100.
